sentences.en: He added humor, irreverence, and a strong speaking style that captivated the audience.
sentences.cn: 他的幽默 、 不恭以及强烈的说话风格吸引了所有的听众.

sentences.en: Irreverence, for example, used at the right time can lighten a mood.
sentences.cn: 例如, 在合适的时候表现出叛逆行为可以缓和情绪的波动.

sentences.en: Mark Twain said irreverence is the champion of liberty, if not its only defender.
sentences.cn: 马克吐温说过,不敬若不是自由唯一的捍卫者,也会是它的拥护者.

sentences.en: These adjectives mean showing or marked by irreverence or contempt for what is sacred.
sentences.cn: 这些形容词的意思是显示出或特征为对神圣事物不尊敬或鄙视的.

sentences.en: This versatile attitude mixes fun and irreverence with edgy style.
sentences.cn: 这种多变的风格包含了乐趣和桀骜的前卫风格.

sentences.en: True irreverence is disrespect for another man's god.
sentences.cn: 真正的大不敬是不尊重别人的神.

sentences.en: We need torch relay, not irreverence to dead, but to bring pride to China!
sentences.cn: 我们需要快乐的火炬传递, 这不是对死者的不敬, 而是为了给所有的中国人带来骄傲.

sentences.en: While this combination often manifested itself in irreverence, it also turned him into one of the most tolerant and open-minded of travelers.
sentences.cn: 凡此种种集其大成，往往有不敬之虞，但有助于他成为心胸最宽广和最开放的旅行者。

trans.tran_cn: 不虔诚；不尊敬；无礼；傲慢
